org.lcsim.geometry.compact.converter

Class SurveyVolume

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.geometry.compact.converter.SurveyVolume
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompactSurveyVolume, HPSTestRunTracker2014GeometryDefinition.ActiveSensor, HPSTestRunTracker2014GeometryDefinition.BaseModule, HPSTestRunTracker2014GeometryDefinition.BasePlate, HPSTestRunTracker2014GeometryDefinition.CSupport, HPSTestRunTracker2014GeometryDefinition.HalfModuleComponent, HPSTestRunTracker2014GeometryDefinition.SupportBottom, HPSTestRunTracker2014GeometryDefinition.SupportPlate, HPSTestRunTracker2014GeometryDefinition.SupportTop, HPSTestRunTracker2014GeometryDefinition.TestRunColdBlock, HPSTestRunTracker2014GeometryDefinition.TrackerEnvelope, HPSTracker2014GeometryDefinition.PSVacuumChamber, HPSTracker2014GeometryDefinition.SupportRing, HPSTracker2014GeometryDefinition.SupportRingL13KinMount, HPSTracker2014GeometryDefinition.SvtBox, HPSTracker2014GeometryDefinition.SvtBoxBasePlate, HPSTracker2014GeometryDefinition.UChannelL13, HPSTracker2014GeometryDefinition.UChannelL46, HPSTracker2014GeometryDefinition.UChannelPlate, HPSTracker2017GeometryDefinition.ActiveShortSensor, HPSTracker2019GeometryDefinition.ActiveShortSensor, HPSTrackerGeometryDefinition.TrackingVolume

    public abstract class SurveyVolume
extends Object
    Contains the geometry information that is used to build any volume.

    • Method Detail

      • setPos

        protected abstract void setPos()

      • setCenter

        protected abstract void setCenter()

      • setBoxDim

        protected abstract void setBoxDim()

      • init

        protected void init()
        Initialize the volume. This needs to be called at the top level implementation of the SurveyVolume to properly setup the coordinate systems. It takes care of applying user supplied custom transformations and alignment corrections in the order given in the function below. That order must be preserved to get a uniform behavior.

      • applySurvey

        private void applySurvey(Element node)

      • applyGenericCoordinateSystemCorrections

        protected void applyGenericCoordinateSystemCorrections()
        Apply a generic correction to the coordinate system of this volume.

      • applyReferenceTransformation

        protected void applyReferenceTransformation()
        Applies a user supplied reference transformation to the module. This is convenient as it allows for intermediary "virtual" mother volumes to be used in referencing a volume to it's physcial mother volume.

      • applyLocalAlignmentCorrections

        private void applyLocalAlignmentCorrections()
        Apply @link AlignmentCorrection to the volume if they are supplied.
